author: Heather Haddon
title: Kroger in Deal to Sell Convenience-Store Business to U.K. Firm
text:
The Kroger Co. is selling its convenience-store business to privately held U.K.-based EG Group for $2.15 billion, the companies said Monday.
EG Group, which operates gas stations and convenience stores across Europe, will establish its North American headquarters in Cincinnati, where Kroger is based, and continue to operate stores under the existing banner names as part of the deal.
